endpoints.name: Public Token Exchange
endpoints.description: Exchange the `publicToken` returned by our hosted authentication flow for a long lived connection token that will be used when requesting data from a customer's TSP.

endpoints.name: List All Connections
endpoints.description: List all of the connections you have for your application. Connections represent the authenticated access you have to your customer's TSP data.

query.description: Pagination cursor to start requests from
The maximum number of results to return in a page.
Filter connections by tag
Filter connections that were last updated on or after a given time.
Filter connections that were last updated on or before a given time.
Filter connections by status
Filter connections by provider

endpoints.name: Get Current Connection
endpoints.description: Get the details of the current active connection. The current connection is derived from the provided connection token.

description.content: (Required) The token returned when a user authenticated their account. This authorizes access to a specific account.

endpoints.name: Update Current Connection
endpoints.description: Update the details of the current active connection. The current connection is derived from the provided connection token.

description.content: (Required) The token returned when a user authenticated their account. This authorizes access to a specific account.

endpoints.name: Request Sync
endpoints.description:
Manually request to sync the current connections data.

By default, Terminal will sync all connections where `syncMode = automatic` on a regular cadence. For customers that may not need a fleet's data to be kept up to date and want to reduce their active tracked trucks, you can set `syncMode = manual` and invoke this endpoint when you want to sync data.

If you're wondering if this is relevent to your use case then feel free to reach out and we'd be happy to assist.

description.content: (Required) The token returned when a user authenticated their account. This authorizes access to a specific account.

endpoints.name: List Sync History
endpoints.description: List a log of all batch sync jobs for the current connection.

query.description: The maximum number of results to return in a page.
Pagination cursor to start requests from
Expand related resources in the response to reduce requests.

description.content: (Required) The token returned when a user authenticated their account. This authorizes access to a specific account.

endpoints.name: Get Sync Job Status
endpoints.description: Get the status of a sync job by ID.

query.description: Expand related resources in the response to reduce requests.

description.content: (Required)
(Required) The token returned when a user authenticated their account. This authorizes access to a specific account.

endpoints.name: Retry Sync
endpoints.description: Retry a failed sync job with the same parameters. This is useful for retrying syncs that failed due to temporary issues.

description.content: (Required) The ID of the sync job to retry
(Required) The token returned when a user authenticated their account. This authorizes access to a specific account.

endpoints.name: Cancel Sync
endpoints.description: Cancel a sync job mid-way through. This is useful for cancelling syncs that are no longer needed. Cancelled syncs will be marked as failed and can be retried.

description.content: (Required) The ID of the sync job to retry
(Required) The token returned when a user authenticated their account. This authorizes access to a specific account.

endpoints.name: Passthrough
endpoints.description:
Make an authenticated request to the underlying telematics provider. 

This endpoint helps ensure that you are never limited by Terminal. You can use passthrough requests to access capabilities that may be limited to a specific TSP or not yet in the normalized model.

Our team is here and ready to support custom use cases that may need `/passthrough`.

description.content: (Required) The token returned when a user authenticated their account. This authorizes access to a specific account.

endpoints.name: Available Time for Drivers
endpoints.description: List available time for the driver. This endpoint provides live access to the driver's available time. Different than most endpoints, this endpoint calls the provider's API in real time to get the latest available time for the driver. This endpoint is useful for building real time applications that need to know the driver's available time.

endpoints.name: Get IFTA Summary
endpoints.description:
Get all vehicle IFTA reports for the requested time span.

Currently can only increment by full months. 

_Note:_ data may change for a few days after the month. We will continue to update those reports to ensure you get accurate results.

query.description: Pagination cursor to start requests from
Expand resources in the returned response
Include raw responses used to normalize model. Used for debugging or accessing unique properties that are not unified.
(Required) The month from which to start including vehicle reports
(Required) Include vehicle reports up to and including this month

Computes the total distance traversed within a specified month range, with the results grouped by either jurisdiction, vehicle, or both. If no grouping parameter is provided, the default grouping is `vehicle,jurisdiction`.

description.content: (Required) The token returned when a user authenticated their account. This authorizes access to a specific account.

endpoints.name: List Issues
endpoints.description:
List all issues that have been observed by Terminal.
Issues are generated when we observe something that may impact the completeness or accuracy of the data we provide but do not justify a full error.
For example, if we lack permissions for a specific resource or need to skip an item due to invalid data.

query.description: The maximum number of results to return in a page.
Pagination cursor to start requests from
Timestamp to start when the issue was last observed
Timestamp to end when the issue was last observed
Expand related resources to see all details
Filter issues to a specific connection
Filter issues to a specific error code
Filter issues to a specific status

endpoints.name: Resolve Issue
endpoints.description: Mark an issue's status as `resolved` until the issue is observed again.

description.content: (Required)

endpoints.name: Latest Vehicle Locations
endpoints.description:
List the latest location of the vehicles in the connected account.
This endpoint will call the provider's API in real time to get the latest location of the vehicle. 
_Please note: this endpoint will exclude vehicles that have no last known location._

endpoints.name: Historical Vehicle Locations
endpoints.description:
List the historical breadcrumb locations for a vehicle.

_Note:_

Given the large volume of location data available, we encourage customers to accept compressed (`gzip`) responses in order to maximize throughput. This is supported with many popular HTTP clients. Result limits vary depending on if results are compressed or not.

query.description: Pagination cursor to start requests from

Timestamp to end at - defaults to now

(Required) The token returned when a user authenticated their account. This authorizes access to a specific account.
